definition: wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn

sentences.english: The ropes were glued into some brass tubing to keep the deadeyes even.
sentences.chinese: 在绳索被粘进黄铜管以均衡保持三眼滑轮。
现在我对滑轮很感兴趣。

sentences.english: It has to be tall because it is like a giant block and tackle
sentences.chinese: 井架必须很高，因为它像一个巨型滑轮组。

sentences.english: If we use the two kinds of pullers together.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们同时使用两种滑轮。

sentences.english: The lifting arm has to have a space cut in for the main pulley.
sentences.chinese: 吊臂上让主要滑轮装置的地方要切掉。

sentences.english: Equipped with anti-skid wheel and brake device that the machinery can run steadily and is safe to use.
sentences.chinese: 配有防滑轮和刹车装置，机器运行平稳，使用安全。

sentences.english: Have you seen these pulleys before?
sentences.chinese: 你以前看过这些滑轮吗？

sentences.english: Pulley group is a kind of lifting accessories.
sentences.chinese: 滑轮组是起重配件的一种。

sentences.english: Help the perforating crew to hoist the pulley for perforating.
sentences.chinese: 协助炮队吊起射孔滑轮。

sentences.english: The forward pulley is large and is generally made from an in-line skate wheel.
sentences.chinese: 远期滑轮大，一般是车轮制成一种在线滑冰。

sentences.english: Watch the propulsion ram and the attached rope pulley in action as the car ascends.
sentences.chinese: 留意当机舱上升时，驱动臂及附载的缆索滑轮的移动。

sentences.english: They reeved the rope through the pulley.
Sliding Door pulley is part of the core technologies must be carefully chosen.
sentences.chinese: 滑轮是推拉门的核心技术部位，一定要慎重选择。

sentences.english: A headwind-going vehicle is made of the pulleys used in curtain track, and some routine things.
sentences.chinese: 利用窗帘轨道中的滑轮和日常生活用品制作了逆风车。

sentences.english: The stone was lifted by means of a rope and pulley .
sentences.chinese: 这块大石是用绳子和滑轮给吊起来的。

sentences.english: I finally hoisted him up with a block and tackle.
sentences.chinese: 我最终用滑轮组把他吊了上去。

definition: rope tackle hanging from a mast/crow foot (system of ropes through tackle to hold up an awning)
lever arm (i.e. perpendicular distance from the fulcrum to the line of force)
pedal (in a car, on a piano etc)/treadle/footstool/footrest/footboard
